meanings.definition: Evidence or argument establishing a fact or the truth of a statement.
meanings.sent1: The detective found proofs that the suspect was at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on proofs to support their theories.
meanings.sent3: The cat left paw prints on the table as proofs of its mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the irrefutable proofs of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprints on the glass were the undeniable proofs of who had been there.

meanings.sent1: The bartender checked the proofs of the whiskey before serving it.
meanings.sent2: The proofs of the rum were higher than expected.
meanings.sent3: The party was lively, but the proofs of the cocktails were stronger.
meanings.sent4: The proofs of the vodka hit him hard after just one sip.
meanings.sent5: The proofs of the tequila were evident in the way it burned going down.
